SEARCH
Package com.creditcardcalculatorbrionblais.controller

Class MainController

java.lang.Object
com.creditcardcalculatorbrionblais.controller.MainController
public class MainController extends Object
Main controller for the credit card calculator application.

This controller serves as the orchestration layer between the UI and the business logic. It handles:

  • Loading transaction data from CSV files
  • Configuring and running account simulations
  • Coordinating between reward policies, payment strategies, and fee schedules

Example usage:

 MainController controller = new MainController();
 List<Transaction> transactions = controller.loadCsv("transactions.csv");
 
 AccountSimulator.Summary summary = controller.simulate(
     transactions,
     RewardPolicy.defaultPolicy(),
     new WallStreetTransactor(),
     AccountSimulator.InterestMethod.SYNCHRONY_DAILY_BALANCE,
     BigDecimal.ZERO,
     LocalDate.of(2024, 1, 1),
     LocalDate.of(2024, 12, 31)
 );
Since:
2024-01-01
Version:
1.0
Author:
Brion Blais

  • Method Details

    • loadCsv

      public List<Transaction> loadCsv(String path) throws IOException
      Loads transactions from a CSV file.

      The CSV file should contain one transaction per line in the format:

      yyyy-MM-dd,Category,Amount

      Example:

       2024-01-15,Groceries,125.50
 2024-01-16,Gas,45.00
      Parameters:
      path - the file path to the CSV file, must not be null
      Returns:
      a list of Transaction objects parsed from the file, never null
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be read or contains invalid data
      NullPointerException - if path is null
      See Also:
      • TransactionReader.readFromCsv(java.io.Reader)

    • simulate

      public AccountSimulator.Summary simulate(List<Transaction> txs, RewardPolicy rewardPolicy, PaymentStrategy paymentStrategy, AccountSimulator.InterestMethod method, BigDecimal startingBalance, LocalDate startDate, LocalDate endDate)
      Runs a credit card account simulation with the specified parameters.

      This method configures an AccountSimulator with all necessary components and executes the simulation across the specified date range.

      The simulation includes:

      • Transaction processing and categorization
      • Reward calculation based on the reward policy
      • Interest calculation using the specified method
      • Fee application (paper statement, late fees, etc.)
      • Payment processing according to the payment strategy
      Parameters:
      txs - the list of transactions to simulate, must not be null
      rewardPolicy - the policy for calculating rewards, must not be null
      paymentStrategy - the strategy for determining payments, must not be null
      method - the interest calculation method (SYNCHRONY_DAILY_BALANCE or AVERAGE_DAILY_BALANCE)
      startingBalance - the initial account balance at the start date
      startDate - the first date of the simulation period, must not be null
      endDate - the last date of the simulation period, must not be null and must not be before startDate
      Returns:
      a Summary containing all simulation results including balances, interest, fees, and time series data
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any parameter is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if endDate is before startDate
      See Also:
      • AccountSimulator.run()
